sen.j: 橘氏 (筑後)（たちばなし）は平安時代の筑後国蒲池の領主の一族。
sen.e: The term "Tachibana clan" (in Chikugo) refers to a clan of the feudal lord of Kamachi, Chikugo Province, in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 筑後国蒲池: 用語集には「Kamachi, Chikugo-no-kuni」と登録されていますが、用語統一リストに従い、「Chikugo Province」と訳しています。
sen.e: The term "Tachibana clan" (in Chikugo) refers to a clan of the feudal lord of Kamachi, Chikugo Province, in the Heian period.
The term "Tachibana clan" (in Chikugo) refers to a clan of the feudal lord of Kamachi, Chikugo Province, in the Heian period.

sen.j: 橘諸兄の五代後の橘広相の五男、従三位中納言の橘公頼が大宰権帥として九州に下向した。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Kimiyori, Jusanmi chunagon (Junior Third Rank, Vice-Councilor of State), who was the fifth son of TACHIBANA no Hiromi, a descendant of the fifth generation from TACHIBANA no Moroe, went to Kyushu as Dazai no gon no sochi (Provisional Governor-General of the Dazaifu [local government office in Kyushu region]).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/従三位中納言: 用語集には「Jusanmi chunagon (Junior Third Rank, Associate Chief of the Councillor of State)」と登録されていますが、用語統一リストに従い、「中納言」は「vice-councilor of state」とし、「従三位」の表記に合わせ、頭文字を大文字にしました。/大宰権帥: 用語集には「Dazai gon no sochi ([略] of the Dazai-fu offices)」と登録されていますが、「だざいのごんのそち」(http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%A4%A7%E5%AE%B0%E6%A8%A9%E5%B8%A5)です。「Dazai-fu」は用語統一リストに従い、ハイフンを削除し、また、説明が必要なため、カッコ内([])に初出の場合の説明を補足し、「offices」はカッコ([])内の説明と重複するため、省略しました。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Kimiyori, Jusanmi chunagon (Junior Third Rank, Vice-Councilor of State), who was the fifth son of TACHIBANA no Hiromi, a descendant of the fifth generation from TACHIBANA no Moroe, went to Kyushu as Dazai no gon no sochi (Provisional Governor-General of the Dazaifu [local government office in Kyushu region]).

TACHIBANA no Kimiyori, Jusanmi chunagon (Junior Third Rank, Vice-Councilor of State), who was the fifth son of TACHIBANA no Hiromi, a descendant of the fifth generation from TACHIBANA no Moroe, went to Kyushu as Dazai no gon no sochi (Provisional Governor-General of the Dazaifu [local government office in Kyushu region]).

sen.j: 藤原純友の乱の時に、大宰府に迫った純友の弟の藤原純乗の軍勢を、柳川市の東方の蒲池で撃退。
sen.e: In FUJIWARA no Sumitomo's War, Kimiyori repelled the troops of FUJIWARA no Suminori (a younger brother of Sumitomo), approaching Dazaifu, in Kamachi in the east area of Yanagawa City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/大宰府: 用語集には「Dazai-fu」という表記も登録されていますが、用語統一リストに従い、ハイフンなしで表記しています。
sen.e: In FUJIWARA no Sumitomo's War, Kimiyori repelled the troops of FUJIWARA no Suminori (a younger brother of Sumitomo) who approached Dazaifu, in Kamachi in the east area of Yanagawa City.
In FUJIWARA no Sumitomo's War, Kimiyori repelled the troops of FUJIWARA no Suminori (a younger brother of Sumitomo) who approached Dazaifu, in Kamachi in the east area of Yanagawa City.

sen.j: その功により公頼の三男の橘敏通は蒲池の領主となった。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Toshimichi, who was the third son of Kimiyori, became the feudal lord of Kamachi in recognition of Kimiyori's services.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 大宰府府官の子孫が蒲池城に拠る。
sen.e: The descendants of the Governor-General of the Dazaifu were based at Kamachi Castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/大宰府府官: 定訳は不明ですが、文脈上、既出の「大宰権帥」を指すと思われますので、それに沿った訳出をしております。
sen.e: The descendants of the Governor-General of the Dazaifu were based at Kamachi-jo Castle.
The descendants of the Governor-General of the Dazaifu were based at Kamachi-jo Castle.

sen.j: 1126年(大治 (日本)元年)に天台宗の僧侶慈光（俗名は蒲池右仁）が長壽院を建立。
sen.e: Jiko, a monk of the Tendai sect, whose secular name was Ujin KAMACHI, built Choju-in Temple in 1126.
sen.cmt: 慈光、蒲池右仁: 読み方が確認できませんが、「じこう」「かまちうじん」と推測しています。/長壽院: 用語集には「Chojuin」と登録されていますが、寺の名称(http://www.tendai924.com/chojuin/)ですので、指示書に従い、「Choju-in Temple」としました。
sen.e: Jiko, a monk of the Tendai sect, whose secular name was Ujin KAMACHI, built Choju-in Temple in 1126.
Jiko, a monk of the Tendai sect, whose secular name was Ujin KAMACHI, built Choju-in Temple in 1126.

sen.j: この蒲池を号とした右仁は筑後の橘氏の人物。
sen.e: Ujin, whose secular surname was Kamachi, was derived from the Tachibana clan in Chikugo.
Ujin, who called himself Kamachi, was derived from the Tachibana clan in Chikugo.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Ujin, who called himself Kamachi, was derived from the Tachibana clan in Chikugo.

sen.j: 源平合戦の功で幕府の西国御家人となり筑後国三潴郡の地頭職となった嵯峨源氏の源久直が橘氏の娘婿となった。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Hisanao of Saga Genji (Minamoto clan), who became Saigoku gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate of the western part of Japan in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and Jitoshiki (manager and lord of manor) of Mizuma County, Chikugo Province, in recognition of his services in the Genpei War, was adopted by his wife's family, which was the Tachibana clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/西国御家人: 用語統一リストに従い、用語集の訳語からハイフンを削除しました。 /「源氏嵯峨源氏」となっていた箇所をWebで確認すると「嵯峨源氏」でしたので、原文を訂正しました。用語集には「Saga-Genji (略)」と登録されていますが、用語統一リストに従い、ハイフンを削除しました。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Hisanao of Saga Genji (Minamoto clan), who became Saigoku gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate of the western part of Japan in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and Jitoshiki (manager and lord of manor) of Mizuma County, Chikugo Province, in recognition of his services in the Genpei War, was adopted by his wife's family, which was the Tachibana clan.

sen.j: 蒲池氏の初代となった。
sen.e: Then he became the first head of the Kamachi clan.
